result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Benjimin B Condra was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Benjimin B Condra appears by video along with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews defendants petition for conditional release, questions whether counsel have agreed on a independent evaluator. Counsel have not discuss examiners. Court appoints Dr. Erik Knudson to conduct independent examination regarding defendants petition for conditional release. Report to be completed by 7/13/17. Hearing date set. Dr. Knudson can appear by phone for 8/09/17 hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Restitution summary
Restitution summary  ($165.30 plus $16.53 DA surcharge for a total due of $181.83) This to be paid within the 9 month commitment period.
of Placement
of commitment (not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect)

Defendant Benjimin B Condra in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Defendant Benjimin B Condra in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas and makes a finding guilty but not guilty by reason of mental discease or defect. State requests a 9 month commitment, requests restitution in the amount of $165.30 plus statutorily authorized surcharges be paid within that 9 month period. If not paid in that period, State would ask then ask that restitution be converted to a civil judgment. Court orders 9 month commit concurrent to commitment in 15-CF-58. Bond is no longer in effect.

Attorney Grant Alexander Erickson in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State advises defendant is still at Winnebago Mental Health, indicates Defense is accepting the State's offer, requests a plea date. Defense concurs.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 11:00 am.
for substitution of counsel

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates defendant is now receiving treatment. Atty Gerber requests a follow up date in 60-90 days. State requests a status in 90 days.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Benjimin B Condra in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Benjimin B Condra in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State not requesting a bond be set as defendant is in custody on a commitment.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
